item.title: KitBash - Aristocracy by Pablo Carpio
item.description:
I had the chance to try the new KitBash minikit, a mix of the Parisian, Victorian and Steampunk kits, really useful to get a bit of each one and still powerful to create full cities!

You can take a better look at its content here: https://kitbash3d.com/collections/kits/products/mini-kit-aristocracy
item.content:encoded:
I had the chance to try the new KitBash minikit, a mix of the Parisian, Victorian and Steampunk kits, really useful to get a bit of each one and still powerful to create full cities!

You can take a better look at its content here: https://kitbash3d.com/collections/kits/products/mini-kit-aristocracy

item.title: Remains Indoors by Pablo Carpio
item.description:
Here's the project that I've been preparing during the last weeks with the help of Jan Urschel for his Learn Squared course about Production Concept Art; a great tool to learn about design and presentation in many ways. It was definetly a great opportunity to push further some skills and software techniques!

Make sure that you take a look to the course and mentorships here: https://www.learnsquared.com/courses/production-concept-art
item.content:encoded:
Here's the project that I've been preparing during the last weeks with the help of Jan Urschel for his Learn Squared course about Production Concept Art; a great tool to learn about design and presentation in many ways. It was definetly a great opportunity to push further some skills and software techniques!

Make sure that you take a look to the course and mentorships here: https://www.learnsquared.com/courses/production-concept-art

item.title: Tres Hermanas by Pablo Carpio
item.description: As a host I was super inspired by all the work submitted for the Wild West Challenge, and I didn't want to miss the chance to show my own take on the theme. I'm not sure if I will have time to do the other three scenes, but here is a small hint of what my story could be about; would love to hear what this moment inspires you and how would you continue the story!
item.content:encoded:
As a host I was super inspired by all the work submitted for the Wild West Challenge, and I didn't want to miss the chance to show my own take on the theme. I'm not sure if I will have time to do the other three scenes, but here is a small hint of what my story could be about; would love to hear what this moment inspires you and how would you continue the story!

View this on ArtStation
Pablo Carpio on ArtStation

item.title: Cross-Section: Jawa Speeder by Pablo Carpio
item.description: Cross Section of a previous concept done back in 2016. I was wondering how a speeder built by the Jawas could look like; maybe a vehicle for traders, or old jedis hiding from the Empire while looking after new hopes
item.content:encoded:
Cross Section of a previous concept done back in 2016. I was wondering how a speeder built by the Jawas could look like; maybe a vehicle for traders, or old jedis hiding from the Empire while looking after new hopes
